message: maybe just use it for chatter
@LucasDailey um, it seems... uh... a lot like campfire. a lot.
@listrophy ah right. I haven't pulled that up in a while. Some reply indents would be nice.
How should this fit into the web608 ecosystem?  We already have the website and the google group.
@listrophy So is this basically persistant chat? What else?
Well, I think there needs to be work on the website.  I've been gradually cleaning it up.  I think the google group works pretty well though.
*shrug* is the existing ecosystem effective? i would argue "no"
Could be, I'm not saying I'm for or against convore, just wondering out loud :)
of course, convore is a startup. this could go away at any time. (although non-startup status didn't save Wave)
I just have to figure out how to manage the 4-5 emails I get for the same thing from the different groups. Web608, Rails, web designers, nonprofit one, etc...
i don't think i like the trend of every YC company getting this much hype.  So far, this is basically IRC with topics. why is this a big deal?
I signed up for the Hacker News group but I can't get any value out of this site at that volume.  It's just too much.  So now this is the only group I'm on.

Plus they e-mail me when someone creates a new topic but not when someone contributes to an existing topic?  That basically means it will be hard to use this for longer conversations.  People will forget about them and never return.
